data.enText: deep hole
a large deep hole in the ground

data.chText: 我们在院子中挖了个深洞。
data.enText: We dug a deep pit in the yard.
The body had been dumped in a pit.
a deep hole in the ground from which minerals are dug out
a chalk/gravel pit
mine
pit closures

data.chText: 他中学一毕业就当矿工了。
data.enText: He went down the pit (= started work as a miner ) when he left school.
in skin
a small shallow hole in the surface of sth, especially a mark left on the surface of the skin by some disease, such as chickenpox
in fruit
a peach pit
in motor racing
the pit
a place near the track where cars can stop for fuel, new tyres, etc. during a race
in theatre
part of body
in business

data.chText: （交易所中某一商品的）交易场所
data.enText: the area of a stock exchange where a particular product is traded
the corn pit
be the pits

data.chText: 是坏典型；是拙劣典型；最糟糕
data.enText: to be very bad or the worst example of sth
the pit of your/the stomach
the bottom of the stomach where people say they feel strong feelings, especially fear

data.chText: 他内心深处突然有一种不祥之感。
data.enText: He had a sudden sinking feeling in the pit of his stomach.
a bottomless pit (of sth)

data.chText: 无限度事物；无休止的状况；无底洞
data.enText: a thing or situation which seems to have no limits or seems never to end

data.chText: 公共开支并非用之不尽。
data.enText: There isn't a bottomless pit of money for public spending.
the bottomless pit of his sorrow
make holes

data.chText: 使…表面有斑点；在…上打洞
data.enText: to make marks or holes on the surface of sth

data.chText: 月亮的表面布满陨石坑。
data.enText: The surface of the moon is pitted with craters.
Smallpox scars had pitted his face.
fruit
pitted olives
pit sb/sth against sth

data.chText: 使竞争；使较量；使经受考验
data.enText: to test sb or their strength, intelligence, etc. in a struggle or contest against sb/sth else

data.chText: 律师和会计师都觉得他们要一争高下。
data.enText: Lawyers and accountants felt that they were being pitted against each other.

data.chText: 一次与世界冠军斗智的机会
data.enText: a chance to pit your wits against the world champions (= in a test of your intelligence)
be the pits

data.chText: 是坏典型；是拙劣典型；最糟糕
data.enText: to be very bad or the worst example of sth
the pit of your/the stomach
the bottom of the stomach where people say they feel strong feelings, especially fear

data.chText: 他内心深处突然有一种不祥之感。
data.enText: He had a sudden sinking feeling in the pit of his stomach.
a bottomless pit (of sth)

data.chText: 无限度事物；无休止的状况；无底洞
data.enText: a thing or situation which seems to have no limits or seems never to end

data.chText: 公共开支并非用之不尽。
data.enText: There isn't a bottomless pit of money for public spending.
the bottomless pit of his sorrow
pit sb/sth against sth

data.chText: 使竞争；使较量；使经受考验
data.enText: to test sb or their strength, intelligence, etc. in a struggle or contest against sb/sth else

data.chText: 律师和会计师都觉得他们要一争高下。
data.enText: Lawyers and accountants felt that they were being pitted against each other.

data.chText: 一次与世界冠军斗智的机会
data.enText: a chance to pit your wits against the world champions (= in a test of your intelligence)

tr: a workplace consisting of a coal mine plus all the buildings and equipment connected with it
lowered area in front of a stage where an orchestra accompanies the performers
a surface excavation for extracting stone or slate
example: a British term for `quarry' is `stone pit'

tr: a trap in the form of a concealed hole
(auto racing) an area at the side of a racetrack where the race cars are serviced and refueled
(commodity exchange) the part of the floor of a commodity exchange where trading in a particular commodity is carried on
an enclosure in which animals are made to fight
(Christianity) the abode of Satan and the forces of evil
example: Hurl'd headlong...To bottomless perdition, there to dwell"- John Milto
a demon from the depths of the pit
Hell is paved with good intentions"-Dr. Johnso

tr: a sizeable hole (usually in the ground)
example: they dug a pit to bury the body

tr: the hard inner (usually woody) layer of the pericarp of some fruits (as peaches or plums or cherries or olives) that contains the seed
example: you should remove the stones from prunes before cooking

tr: a concavity in a surface (especially an anatomical depression)

example: let them match their best athletes against ours
pit a chess player against the Russian champion
He plays his two children off against each other
The skin disease scarred his face permanently

example.ex: It was a better community then when all the pits were working.
example.tran: 所有的煤矿都在开工的那个时候，这个社区的情况要更好一些。

value.def: A pit is a large hole that is dug in the ground.

example.ex: Eric lost his footing and began to slide into the pit.
example.tran: 埃里克一脚踩空，开始往坑里滑。

value.def: A gravel pit or clay pit is a very large hole that is left where gravel or clay has been dug from the ground.

example.ex: This area of former farmland was worked as a gravel pit until 1964.
example.tran: 这块过去曾是农田的地1964年前一直被用作沙砾坑。

value.tran: （挖出沙砾或黏土后留下的）坑，窑

value.def: If two opposing things or people are pitted against one another, they are in conflict.

example.ex: You will be pitted against people who are every bit as good as you are...
example.tran: 你将和与你势均力敌的对手展开竞争。

example.ex: This was one man pitted against the universe.
example.tran: 这是一个人挑战整个宇宙。

value.def: In motor racing, the pits are the areas at the side of the track where drivers stop to get more fuel and to repair their cars during races.

example.ex: He moved quickly into the pits and climbed rapidly out of the car.
example.tran: 他迅速进入检修加油站，飞快地爬出赛车。

value.def: If you describe something as the pits, you mean that it is extremely bad.

example.ex: Mary Ann asked him how dinner had been. 'The pits,' he replied.
example.tran: 玛丽·安问他晚餐怎么样，他回答说：“糟透了。”

value.def: A pit is the stone of a fruit or vegetable.
If you pit your wits against someone, you compete with them in a test of knowledge or intelligence.

example.ex: I'd like to pit my wits against the best.
example.tran: 我希望同最优秀的对手斗智。

value.def: If you have a feeling in the pit of your stomach, you have a tight or sick feeling in your stomach, usually because you are afraid or anxious.

example.ex: I had a funny feeling in the pit of my stomach.
example.tran: 我心头有种怪怪的感觉。

trans: 取之不竭的事物；宝藏；无底洞
停车加油(或修理等)；(长途旅行中的)短暂休息，歇脚
火山坑；熔岩穴；（熏房的）燃烧坑
比特犬；斗牛犬；斗牛梗；交易冠军；牛头犬
蝮蛇(用头部的热敏部位寻找食物)
